div.span: Don't have an account? Register now

p.a: Central Falls is Making Headlines. Click here to read the latest.
Our Commitment: From Clean Government to Clean Streets.
Improved Customer Service: payments now accepted online and with credit cards!

div.div:
Translate/Traducir/Traduzir
function googleTranslateElementInit() { new google.translate.TranslateElement({pageLanguage: 'en', layout: google.translate.TranslateElement.InlineLayout.SIMPLE}, 'google_translate_element'); }
COVID-19 (Novel Coronavirus)Â Information
please click here
Â
Important notice on City Services
Â
We are operating by appointment only. To make an appointment or drop something off, please call the appropriate department (listed below) or the Mayorâ€™s Hotline at 401-727-7474.
Estamos operando solo con cita previa. Para hacer una cita o dejar algo, llame al departamento correspondiente (que se detalla a continuaciÃ³n) o a la lÃ­nea directa del alcalde al 401-727-7474.
Notice on Tax Collection Changes
Thank you for visiting the City of Central Fallsâ€™Â website.
Â Â Â Â Â Â Central Falls is a city rich in history, diversity and entrepreneurial spirit. I encourageÂ you to visit Central Falls in person to experience our great restaurants and shops in our walk-able business districts. Our great city is home to nineteen thousand proud residents who are busy building a better future for Central Falls; a future I invite you to experience today.Â
Â Â Â Â Â
Â Â Â Â Â With a proud history starting in 1731, the City of Central Falls offers great opportunities for small business investment on our majorÂ thoroughfares. Centrally located in southern New England with easy access to Providence, Boston, Hartford and Worcester, the city features former mill space that hearkens back to its roots as the birthplace of the American Industrial Revolution; adding to the charm of the city.
Â
Â Â Â Â Â The cityâ€™s diverse population offers an abundance of cultural riches â€“ culinary, artistic, linguistic and beyond. At the same time, this wealth of diversity also provides bridges to nearly 100 countries abroad, allowing the city a unique opportunity to enjoy a wide array of cultural benefits.
Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â
Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Cogswell Tower in Jenks Park
Â Â Â Â Nestled between the City of Pawtucket and the Towns of Cumberland andÂ Lincoln, the City of Central Falls is also compact. In fact, its 19,000+ citizensÂ inhabit less than 1.3 square miles, making it quite walk-able as well asÂ appealing for retailers. The city has recently focused on creating community gardens and sports fields wherever green space can be added to provide new communal spaces for our citizens and visitors alike to enjoy.
Â Â
Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â New Veterans Memorial Park
Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â 950-954 Dexter Street
Feel free to contact me by calling the Mayorâ€™s Office at (401) 727-7474 or emailing me atÂ mayor@centralfallsri.us.Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â
Welcome to the City of Central Falls.
Thank you,
James A. Diossa
Â
Â
Looking for information about the City Council Meetings?
ClickÂ hereÂ to live stream the Central Falls City Council MeetingÂ Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â
ClickÂ hereÂ for minutes, agendas or videos from past meetings
Click here for videos of council meetings held before September 2018
Â
Looking for the Adopted Budget?
ClickÂ hereÂ for Central Falls' FY20 Adopted Budget
Â
Looking for a Job Opportunity in the City or to Bid?
ClickÂ here for Job OpportunitiesÂ with the City of Central Falls
ClickÂ here for Invitations to Bids
Â
Â Â
Do you like this page?
